The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 27 May is 42,158 (4,879.5 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 22 May, there were 42 new confirmed cases (4.9 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 15 May, there were 82 new cases, and so the new cases have decreased by 49% (40 fewer cases).
